subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: Previously, on
Survivor... Here in Samoa, there are two
tribes going in two different directions.
For the purple tribe, Galu, it's sunshine and rainbows.
>> \xe2\x99\xaa Coco rico In my belly... \xe2\x99\xaa
>> PROBST: They've won both immunity challenges, and
everyone is happy. (laughter)
Everyone except Shambo. >> The way that the rest of
the tribe does things is way different than the way that I do
things, and it's very frustrating.
>> PROBST: Losing has frustrated everyone on Foa Foa...
everyone except Russell. >> I didn't come here to work.
I came here to play. >> PROBST: Russell is the first
person in Survivor history to find a hidden immunity idol
without any clues. >> Boo-yah.
>> PROBST: He's figured out how to manipulate the others into
doing his bidding. >> They can be my little
puppets. They'll run when I tell 'em to
run, they'll walk when I tell 'em to walk.
And when I'm finished with them, I'll just throw 'em in the
trash. >> PROBST: Meanwhile, Ben put
people on edge without even trying.
(Ben babbling gibberish) He got kicked out of a
challenge... >> PROBST: Stop!
First time in the history of Survivor.
Take a spot here-- you're done. ...kept everyone up all night...
...and lashed out at a visitor from the other tribe.
>> If I was a girl, I would slap you, is what I would do.
Ghetto trash, plain and simple. >> PROBST: Ben's actions put a
target on his back. >> We got a loss because he got
thrown out of the challenge yesterday.
Ben would be the right choice to kick out-- he's crazy.
>> PROBST: But Russell wanted Betsy out, because Betsy didn't
trust him. >> Why didn't you trust me from
the beginning? You're gonna look back on this
and regret it. >> PROBST: At Tribal Council,
Russell got his way. Ben was spared, and Betsy was
voted out. 17 are left.
Who will be voted out tonight? >> I did a lot of thinking last
night. What have you been thinking?
>> I've been thinking Ben's got to be the next to go.
>> Tell me why, is that for personal reasons?
>> The guy's mean. >> I agree with you.
>> I want him out. >> You see how he laid into her?
I mean, it wasn't just an argument.
It got really personal and, I think, inappropriate.
>> "Ghetto trash." That's not necessary.
>> Totally. Like, that's terrible.
At the last Tribal Council, Ben was this close from saying
something to Yasmin that would've made me fly over a
stool and say... and not even say but, you know, put him down.
We voted off Betsy, but at this point, Ben is a mental plague on
our tribe. >> Ashley.
How you feel? >> I feel good.
>> How you feel about last night?
>> It's always brutal, but it was the... I mean, it was the
majority, it was the plan, so... >> Do you have any in mind who
you would want to...? >> Gosh.
>> Nobody here's playing the game.
Nobody is playing the game but me, on my tribe.
Not one person-- it's crazy. >> I think we should definitely
see how today goes before we start discussing...
>> Well, today's just a reward, I hope.
>> Yeah, I don't know what today is.
>> I don't know, this might be the worst group in history, and
I might be the best. I'm gonna have them all under
control like zombies walking around. Mmm...
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa (birds chirping)
>> Did you put a ton in or just enough to cover the top a little
bit? >> If that doesn't get it
started, I don't know what the hell will.
>> Just... let me just show you one time.
Hold it really, really tight... >> Mm-hmm.
>> ...and try to push that spark into there.
You want to try? >> Yeah.
>> Just doing that, though, you're gonna destroy the flint.
>> Yeah? >> Yeah.
We're almost out of flint, 'cause these people don't know
what they're doing. I'm the only one that knows how
to start the fire. I think a lot of these people
out here, they're not used to being out in the woods.
Kind of pansies and... Mick's not an outdoorsy guy like
myself. I wasn't surprised he didn't
know how to do it. I tried to show him and give him
a few tips. Didn't really help.
>> It's usually a little bit easier than this, yeah?
>> Not with a flint like that. >> Really?
>> Want me to try for a sec? >> Yeah.
>> Without my help, these people will die.
I save the day once again. >> Oh, you got it going?
>> Yeah. >> Nice.
>> I started the fire this morning.
Mick was trying to. He was having a lot of
trouble with it. It's a lot of technique, it's
a lot of strength. Like, not to be chauvinistic,
not to put you girls down-- you won't be able to start the fire
with the flint. The way it's worn down, it's,
like, flat? >> Yeah.
>> If you just try, like, it's gonna be, like, you're just
gonna waste it. So I wouldn't even... I wouldn't
even attempt to. I'm not just saying that.
You're hands aren't big enough-- you can't grip the machete and
get down and do it. >> Ben is trying to tell
everybody they can't survive without Ben.
Which, hey, I applaud it. You're trying to save yourself.
But that's not how you do it. >> Ben, did you sleep last
night? >> First time in seven days.
Did you poop yet? >> No.
>> I pooped this morning, and it was, like, the biggest poop, I
think, in my life. >> Ew.
>> You see, as long as Ben keeps his crazy rantics going on, his
ass is gonna be on the line. >> You want to bite me?
You want something to bite on? I got something for you, buddy.
>> I got to keep Ben here a little bit longer, 'cause he's
good for the challenges, and he's the strongest guy around
the camp. So I'm gonna have to debate
which baby I'm gonna have to send home next.
>> Lizard, anybody? \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> Exhale out slowly through the nose.
>> You got it. >> Again. Nice strident back,
all the way up. Breath in through the nose.
Hold it in. Right now we're winning.
We're feeling good. There's great morale.
We're working hard. We're all pitching in at camp.
We're all doing stuff. Exhale out.
So we don't have to always be in game mode, and that's a huge,
huge advantage that we have over Foa Foa.
And relax. >> Are you frickin' kidding me?
We got four people doing yoga this morning?
I'm kind of alienated from my tribe, 'cause I'm not in the
90210 clique. >> We're gonna do this slow two
more times, then we're gonna put it in rhythm.
>> I'm not doing the warm and fuzzy, I'm doing the Rambo
Shambo provider role out here. >> Feet up at an angle.
>> Do we have water? No. Do we have food? No.
Do we have firewood? No. Screw yoga, man.
>> So what I'm figuring is, she's becoming a threat to us.
So, uh, one thing I do know for a fact is she was trying to get
rid of you. >> Oh, man.
>> "Got to get rid of Ben. Got to get rid of Ben."
So just don't tell her nothin'. We're gonna sneak her.
We're gonna tell her whoever, and then we're gonna all vote
for her. The reason I told Ben about
Ashley gunning for him is 'cause right now I think I need Ben.
So every person that tries to get rid of him, I'm gonna get
rid of them. I don't want her to start
talking, "Ben, Ben, Ben, Ben, Ben."
>> Nobody listens to her anyway. >> Yeah. So, you know, just keep
it to where we can blindside her.
>> Cool. >> All right, man.
I'm telling you, you plant that little seed in their head, in
their little brain, and then it grows, and it's called a
"Russell seed." It takes over their whole mind.
So that makes it easy for me to manipulate every single one of
them. >> You know what?
Last night you stabbed me in the back.
>> I did nothing wrong. I was playing the game.
>> You didn't come to me when you heard something about me, at
all. >> Because I didn't think I
needed to at that exact moment. >> You know what?
That's the easiest thing, to come and say, "Hey, you know
what, everybody's talking about you."
I had to find out from somebody else.
>> Who'd you find out from? >> It wasn't Russell, that's all
I'm saying. And I don't trust you, so I'm
not gonna say anything else. That's not surprising.
>> When people fight, I love that.
How can they not even think it was me, you know?
These people are just idiots. It is shocking that these people
trust me so much. I mean, they really do.
Everybody here trusts me. >> No, that's not true.
>> I know. >> I can promise you that's not
true. >> No, I know.
You gonna say something to him? I did not say that. I didn't.
>> You know what I told him, I was, like, you know what, I'm
not gonna fight with you. >> I've never been so confused
in my entire life. Yesterday Ben's name got thrown
around by everyone, and apparently, someone said that I
was the one that brought it up, so I do not feel safe.
I want to know who told him. >> Brett's back, Monica's back.
>> Tree mail! >> I love presents.
>> Is everyone here? >> Oh, there's a... like, a bag.
>> I know. >> I like the feel, though.
>> You see over here? I just want to go over here.
>> Like the feel. That's a pillowcase right there.
>> Oh! (indistinct chatter)
>> You ready? >> All right, go ahead.
>> Yeah, go ahead. >> "If you can't run or swim or
lift or carry, then you'd better be damn smart.
Only one tribe stays home safe and comfy while the loser shall
depart." >> Wow.
>> Bathing suits! >> Yeah, dude.
>> Yay! (cheering)
>> All right, so... >> Oh.
>> Yay! >> Yes.
>> So we got tree mail today. It came with this nice comfy

be swimsuits. I'm putting this right on right
now! So now, here it is.
And it feels awesome and dry and soft and fabulous.
Oh, yay! I can't even tell you how
amazing this feels. >> Shambo, how you feeling?
>> Ready to rock 'n' roll, man. I got my jogger bra on.
(laughs) >> I just did it the wrong way.
>> 'Cause you're the blonde. >> Of course.
(laughter) Of course.
>> PROBST: Come on in, guys! Galu getting your first look at
the new Foa Foa tribe. Betsy voted out at the last
Tribal Council. You'll also notice that Mike
Borassi is gone from the game. Medical's decision, not his.
Nonetheless, he is gone. Foa Foa is now down to seven.
Guys ready to get to today's challenge?
>> Yup. >> Yeah.
>> PROBST: First things first. I will take back the immunity

Once again, immunity is back up for grabs.
For today's challenge, two members of each tribe will swim
out to retrieve a crate. The section between the four
flags is a battle zone where a defender from the other tribe
will be waiting to try to slow you down.
It will get physical. Once both swimmers get through
the zone, you're free to retrieve your crate.
Once you have your crate back to the mat, the next two go.
Once you've collected all four crates, you must stack them so
that there are no repeating colors on any side.
First tribe to get it right wins a lot.
Immunity. If you have immunity, you do
not go to Tribal Council. You cannot be voted out of this
game. In addition, the winning tribe
wins reward. A lot of comfort.
>> Oh! >> Yay!
>> Oh! >> It's a hammock!
